results.title: Get out your handkerchiefs = Preparez vos mouchoirs
results.creator_credit: Bertrand Blier, Paul Claudon, Alexande Minouchkine, George Dancigers and Interama
results.brief_description: Gerard Depardieu is Raoul, a young working-class man devoted to his wife, Solange, played by Carole Laure. Convinced that Solange has tired of him, he convinces a stranger, Stephan (Patrick Dewaere), to enter a menage-a-trois with himself and Solange. However, no matter how hard they try, no matter how much love they offer Solange, they are unable to bring a smile to her face or make her fall pregnant (which they believe is all that she really needs). A trip away to a summer camp leads to Solange meeting the precocious Christian, a thirteen year old boy with the IQ of a genius. At first, she attempts to mother the boy, but finds herself slowly seduced by him, and Stephan and Raoul can only stand-by and watch as the teenager gives Solange everything they cannot. This wickedly sly comedy about marriage, sexual mores, and the differences between men and women won the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language film in 1978. Though definitely absurdist in its sensibility, “Get Out Your Handkerchiefs” refuses to treat its characters cynically or cruelly. Rather, it is as if in examining the fall-out of the sexual revolution, Blier’s response is to throw up his arms, laugh at the madness of it all, and finally to celebrate the madness of the battle of the sexes. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Lacombe Lucien [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Louis Malle, Hallelujuh, VIDES Cinematografica, Universal Pictures France and Nouvelles Éditions de Films
results.brief_description: Lucien Lacombe (Pierre Blaise) is a young peasant trying to make ends meet in Nazi-occupied France. Bored with his job cleaning in a country hospital, he first tries joining the Resistance, then the Gestapo, in his search for excitement and to earn some extra cash. He puts his own success as a collaborator at risk, however, when he finds himself falling in love with, and then exploiting, the daughter of a Jewish tailor (Aurore Clement). Using an almost detached camera, Louis Malle’s controversial film is a verite-style drama of corruption, apathy and amorality. Young Lucien’s succumbing to the allure and promises of the Nazis’ is not an isolated act but a response to the casual war profiteering, prostitution and opportunism that he sees the adults around him engaging in. What is truly shocking is the ease with which people are shown becoming accustomed to the most vile and extreme acts of torture and genocide. Malle’s discreet and circumspect mise-en-scene resists manipulating the viewer through sensationalism or moral self-righteousness; Lucien’s descent is all too identifiably human. On it’s release “Lacombe Lucien” was widely acclaimed as one of the director’s greatest films, but it was also savagely maligned as a betrayal of the heroism of the French people, and a betrayal of the promise and hopes of the Resistance (a criticism echoed by both left and right). In the end, “Lacombe Lucien” is one of the few films that can be argued to not only de-romanticise our most popular conceptions of war, but also manages to deal effectively, bravely and unforgettably, with the “banality of Evil”. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: St. Elmo's fire
results.creator_credit: Joel Schumacher, Lauren Shuler and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: This 80s Brat Pack film from Joel Schmacher depicts the ups and downs of life for a group of young college graduate friends who are looking for something beyond their diplomas. Leslie and Alex live together and argue over when to get married. Meanwhile, Kevin is secretly in love with Leslie as he passes his time writing obituaries for the newspaper. Wendy works for the welfare department and is in love with Billy, though her rich parents want her married and running the family franchise. Billy keeps living life like he just graduated, and is trying to stay faithful and sober enough to get back with his wife and baby. Jules experiences crisis after crisis as she spirals into debt, taking drugs, drinking and partying. Kirby is obsessed with an old flame. Cast includes: Rob Lowe, Demi Moore, Andrew McCarthy, Judd Nelson, Ally Sheedy, Emilio Estevez and Andie MacDowell.

results.title: Cold cuts = Buffet froid [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Bertrand Blier, Alain Sarde, Antenne-2 and Sara Films
results.brief_description: Alphonse Tram discovers his penknife planted in the belly of a moribund accountant lying in a subway corridor. He tries to engage in a conversation with the moribund who rebuffs him. Lost and angry, Alphonse goes back home to the modern tower where he lives with his wife. She introduces him to their new neighbour, a police inspector. Later Alphonse’s wife is found murdered and her hapless murderer almost immediately confesses to Alphonse, but neither the husband, nor the police inspector seem to be shocked. The three sit down to enjoy a friendly drink when a man arrives and accuses Alphonse of the subway murder. ‘Buffet Froid’ is a wonderfully absurd black comedy that cunningly reverses the conventions of the crime thriller to comment on the alienating and dehumanizing effects of contemporary urban life. Cast includes Gerard Depardieu, Bernard Blier, Jean Carmet, Genevieve Page, Michel Serrault, Carole Bouquet, Jean Rougerie, Bernard Crombey, Denise Gence, Jean Benguigui and Liliane Rovere. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Lift to the scaffold = L'Ascenseur pour l'echafaud
results.creator_credit: Louis Malle, Jean Thuillier and Nouvelles Éditions de Films
results.brief_description: This taut, tense and incredibly fast paced thriller features Jeanne Moreau and Maurice Ronet as passionate lovers who embark on a plan to murder her husband. However, the plan goes terribly wrong when the murderer finds himself trapped in a faulty lift. While his lover searches frantically through Paris for him, he grows increasingly more desperate, and she finds herself trapped in another’s scheming plans. Based on a novel by Noel Calef, Louis Malle directs with an audacious vitality, while Moreau and Ronet are wonderful as the callous lovers. The film’s musical score is by jazz legend Miles Davis. The film won the prestigious Prix Delluc, one of French cinema’s most important awards. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Children of the marshland = Les Enfants du marais [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jean Becker, Herve Truffaut, Fechner Productions and UGC Images
results.brief_description: Following his demobilization at the end of WWI, Garris (Jacques Gamblin) wanders around country France, until the day he meets an old man (Jacques Dufilho) living in a marshland and lets himself be talked into dropping his swag and tasting life as a free man. Very soon Garris becomes de facto mentor to his immediate neighbours, Riton (Jacques Villeret), a devoted father with a penchant for the bottle, his wife and three children. The rest of the story is told by Cri-Cri, the youngest of Riton’s children, and through the audience is introduced to the many characters and threads of life that constitute the town bordering on the marshlands: Amedee, the jazz-loving dandy, Jo Sardi, boxer with a rather nasty streak, Marie, the maid who captures Garris’ heart, and above all Mister Richard (a.k.a Pepe la Grenouille), a former marshland resident turned industrialist who yearns to return where his heart truly belongs. This is a work of openly declared nostalgia for irretrievably vanished days. Veteran filmmaker Jean Becker declared that this adaptation from a novel by Georges Montforez was not targeted at an elderly audience, rather he made this film for his grandchildren, to show them a world before Internet and Nintendo. Presented in letterbox version to retain the original widescreen format. Cast also includes Michel Serrault, Andre Dussolier, Eric Cantona and Suzanne Flon. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Sure thing
results.creator_credit: Rob Reiner, Roger Birnbaum and Embassy Pictures Corporation (US)
results.brief_description: Walt Gibson, “Gib”, is a college freshman from the East Coast obsessed with “scoring”. After striking out with fellow student, Alison - the control freak, he decides to head west to California after his best friend assures him of a “sure thing”. What Gib doesn’t know is that Alison is also planning a trip to California to visit her stuffy fiancee. They end up sharing the same ride and misadventures, which ultimately draws them together. Cast includes: John Cusack, Daphne Zuniga, Boyd Gaines, Tim Robbins, Lisa Persky and Anthony Edwards.

results.title: Joseph and the amazing technicolor dreamcoat
results.creator_credit: David Mallet, Steven Pimlott, Andrew Lloyd Webber and Really Useful Films
results.brief_description: The first musical blockbuster by the immensely successful Rice and Weber song writing duo, this straight-to-video recording of the spectacular stage production features Donny Osmond as Joseph. Based on the Biblical story of Joseph and his coat of many colors. Joseph is the favorite son of Jacob (Richard Attenborough), but his eleven brothers resent the attention their father showers upon him and sell him into slavery. Eventually, the favored son finds himself in jail, however his favorable interpretation of the dreams of the Pharaoh win him the admiration of the all-powerful leader, and soon Joseph is one of the most powerful men in Egypt. Songs include ‘Close Every Door to Me, ‘Go Go Go Joseph’ and ‘Any Dream Will Do’. Cast also includes Joan Collins and David Grindrod.

results.title: The Young poisoner's handbook
results.creator_credit: Benjamin Ross, Sam Taylor, Sam Taylor Productions and Mass Productions
results.brief_description: 14 year old Graham’s experience with a failed science experiment leads him into a life long obsession with poisons and their effect on those around him. Failing to do away with his first victim - his best friend - Graham charts the slow demise of his step-mother, in the interim maiming his older sister. Once the young poisoner’s crimes are discovered, he is detained in a centre for the criminally insane. From this point on Graham’s battle with redemption and the desire for infamy are followed with dark humour. Deemed to be beyond his unfortunate psychopathic beginnings, Graham finds life outside of ‘Harshurst’ all too seductive for a young poisoner to bare, his new colleagues coming to this realisation just a little too late. Based on the true story of the St Alban’s poisoner.

results.description: 14 year old Graham’s experience with a failed science experiment leads him into a life long obsession with poisons and their effect on those around him. Failing to do away with his first victim - his best friend - Graham charts the slow demise of his step-mother, in the interim maiming his older sister. Once the young poisoner’s crimes are discovered, he is detained in a centre for the criminally insane. From this point on Graham’s battle with redemption and the desire for infamy are followed with dark humour. Deemed to be beyond his unfortunate psychopathic beginnings, Graham finds life outside of ‘Harshurst’ all too seductive for a young poisoner to bare, his new colleagues coming to this realisation just a little too late. Based on the true story of the St Alban’s poisoner.

results.title: Suspicion
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: A dowdy and repressed young woman, a colonel’s daughter who has led a sheltered life, is irresistibly attracted to a man who is romantic and reckless, a rejection of everything her family background and upbringing have stood for. After their marriage she finds that he is a liar and, she suspects, a murderer. She comes to believe that he plans to murder her. Although the ending is apparently not what Hitchcock originally intended, the film as it now stands does not run counter to his interest in the themes of paranoia and the fragility of relationships. Cast includes Cary Grant, Joan Fontaine, Sir Cedric Hardwicke, Nigel Bruce and Dame May Whitty. Adapted from the novel ‘Before the Fact’ by Francis Iles.
